title: If Ornn is getting nerfed again...
body:
Then can we get the unstoppable added back? It's obvious that it wasn't the nerf he really needed, and it wouldn't be that bad to just say that the nerf didn't do what you were hoping, and it ended up hurting his overall kit instead of weakening it.

It was a really cool aspect that rewarded good play and timing, but there wasn't any punishment for spamming it off of its really low cooldown. Getting rid of that aspect just made his kit simpler and nerfed experienced players. Without that added skill and nerfing the damage on top of that, I'm afraid he'll fall to the bottom and left to rot.

Please don't kill one of my last remaining top laners.

They just need to reduce the % value (Edit: on Brittle) which in turn will reduce his Ult damage which will then make him both more balanced in lane and teamfights.

And ofcourse add back unstoppable. I've never found unstoppable to be the reason he was strong ever.

They did change the numbers.

Originally, Ornn's W did 25% current health as damage, when they changed it to max health, they made it 20%.

Sorry I confused myself. I was thinking about both functions of W but talking about each one without identifying.

I meant they needed to reduce his *Brittle* % health damage now. And that would make him more balanced in lane and teamfights.

> By what measure is he so strong in lane? His winrate is not even good.

Winrates don't clearly define how strong a champion is. Think Ryze and Azir for example, they don't have the most appealing of winrates, but you consistently see them picked at higher elos. The reason Ornn is oppressive in laning phase is aside from zoning off melee champions from farming with his W, the brittle debuff after he applies it lasts far too long. That is a six second window where you, early on, will most likely be unable to trade efficiently against Ornn or farm without pressure at all. Remember that it also does a burst of percent max hp added onto the amount of damage the W itself applies. Tanks should not be so oppressive early game.
